details.notes: A gritting and stop-start kind of game in the first half, mainly due to I'm the star Nick Walsh as referee. 'Well were quick on the break and got some decent shots on goal, with the first goal coming from youngster Ewan Wilson. Then the fun started with a timely RED card for the Dons with some unsporting behaviour from Slobodan Rubezic. To compound matters after the dust settles Maswanhise scores a brilliant second goal. Very scrappy second half, with very little to write home about. A much needed 3 points to the 'Well. #COYW!!

A performance Mark Knopfler would be proud of = DIRE! Worst game for a LONG time, nae desire, nae cohesion, nae points. 6 shots on goal for Motherwell for the whole game, regardless of forcing Craig Gordon into a couple of great saves - single figure efforts on goals IS NOT good enough. #COYW!!

Great start to the game, with the Glasgow team on the back foot after two Motherwell goals. Came out all guns blazing in the second half and pulled one back quite early on. Two more HORRENDOUS decisions from VAR where a perfectly decent goal is chopped off for encroachment to the goal keeper, after he palmed the ball into his own net and an incredible micrometer offside against Dan Casey. Manager red carded for praising the referee - Kevin Clancy is an absolute arse! 2 points STOLEN from Motherwell and we should be a position higher in the league.#COYW!!
An expected defeat to the league leaders, some promising moments, but not enough to give any glimmers of hope. Onwards and upwards! #COYW!!

Good goal from Motherwell early in the game, but little creativity thereafter. Game was dominated by rotten refereeing - the red card for Casey is embarrassing and trended quickly as one of the worst decisions ever in Scottish Football. Nothing more to do than chalk it up to poor stewarship. Chris Graham should be ashamed of himself! #COYW!!

Great start from the 'Well with a very early goal. Made all the more painfull by the softest of penalties straight after it. Another flap or two in the box making it nervous viewing and a embarrassing second goal for the visitors. Fair result in the end, despite NOT getting a penalty which had more obvious and clearcut contact than the one awarded in the first half to Dundee. #COYW!!

A very soft second yellow for the Buddies, gave us a free-kick and a man advantage in the box. Tony Watt stepped up and put the ball in the net! Hardly a world class game, but a good result for the 'Well in the end and a very welcomed three points. #COYW!!
Dismal!

Two poor mistakes from Oxborough made it an uphill task to salvage anything from this game. That was made impossible with the lack of invention or creativity from the 'Well. Another loss signals a downward turn in the direction of points and the manager needs to stop the rot asap. #COYW!!

A poor result after travelling in trecherous conditions for the supporters who braved the A9. Little to write home about and not much to take from it. Sparrow picked up a knock and looks doubtful for the next few games. Still in top 6 so can't complain too much. #COYW!!

Another great result for the 'Well.  Lennon Miller as captain again and crossing the ball brilliantly around the pitch. Two early goals, but no killer instinct, so a repeat of the nervous defending for the last 35+ mins. Important victory before the winter break. Keep up the good work boys.

A somewhat messy affair up in Dundee, but shows the spirit of the team and their drive to defend and counter attack.  A defensive blunder cost United dearly for our second goal. Swap positions with United for us to go back into Fourth in the league!

Another home defeat made even more painful as we had a number of shots on target and hit the post on two occassions. Lennon Miller doing what he does best. Neverthless, Celtic are THE quality side and an expected loss for us. But we came close to spoiling the party a little...

A home defeat at the hands of a strong Dundee.  Rallied in the second half to batter their defences, but unable to penetrate and sink a goal. Unfortunately, the whistle came before we were able to equalise. Onwards and upwards.

Nightmare for Stephen O'Donnell in the box, couldn't clear his feet and Hibbies pounced. A red card for Hibs opens the game back up for the 'Well and Andy Halliday, of all people, steps up and nets a goal. #COYW 4th in the league!

A great performance from Lennon Miller to secure all 3 points. Nervous moments with red cards for both teams, penalties and the one against us SAVED. Scrappy and somewhat ill-tempered with a fair number of the players having played against or alongside each other in previous Motherwell mateches. The team dug deep and pulled out a vital victory to continue a good run of form.

Some brilliant passages of play when the 'Well were totally in control. A wonder strike from former Steelman Louis Moult put them under pressure but they rose to the occassion. None more so than the ever talented Lennon Miller. Slotting home a penalty to give the 'Well the ticket to Hampden.  Hard fought in places towards the end but excellent indication of what this group of players can achieve.

Some positives to take on the road back to Motherwell, but sadly not three points. A late effort from Moses got us on the score sheet, just a little too late in the game for any momentum. Aberdeen defended too strongly and by the number of cards dished out to 'Well players it was somewhat scrappy. Not crest fallen, but a bump in the road to consistency. #COYW - still 5th!

Set pieces appear to be the road to success for the 'Well. Dan Casey making his presence felt in the box and slotting in a lovely headed effort. St. Johnstone came back into it, against the run of play but 'Well dug deep and made some informed subs. Life cam back into the game again and a worthy winner for Moses Ebiye to take all three points. It clearly meant a lot to the management team as they came onto the pitch to thank the travelling support. A great result - more of the same please. 5th in the league !

Motherwell played some of the nicest football as they have in a LONG time.  The manager was very pleased as were the supporters. A rare captain and vice captain goal tally, with a very cheeky number from young Sparrow to round off the game.  Lots of positives to take away ! #COYW.

Very scrappy game with Motherwell having a LOT of possession once Kilmarnock went down to ten men.  Some great chances for the majority of the second half, but no killer instinct or finishing touch. Extra time proved to be were the change happened and Moses Ebiye was the difference, with an excellent headed goal.  Lennon Miller played his socks off and rightly got a standing ovation from the Well supporters.

The big positive for Kettlewell will be his team's spirited second-half showing. The obvious negative is the injury to summer signing Stamatelopoulos.The Australia international, making his first start since April, had a limited pre-season but impressed with his link-up play early in the game, playing a role in a golden first-half chance for Lennon Miller.If the striker is to face any time on the sidelines, he will join an injury list that is getting out of hand.His replacement, Zach Robinson, also caused problems for the Rangers defence, firstly slicing over from inside the area before forcing Jack Butland to make a fine stop low to his left in the second half.The Motherwell forward line were guilty of passing up opportunities in last weekend's draw with Ross County, and the League Cup group game against Partick Thistle.That is an issue Kettlewell will be desperate to address immediately, given his side have now failed to score in their past three games.

A handful of chances from Motherwell but Ross Laidlaw in goals for County was having an outstanding match.  Some excellent saves and body positioning to make the 'Well players work hard for any chance of goals. Not a great match but a big improvement on Partick Thistle performance.

A whole new level of awful. Stuart Kettlewell admitted he felt 'pure anger' with his teams performance, despite it being enough to progress to the Premier Sports Cup last 16. Getting beaten 3-1 on penalties isn't good enough. Not even on the same planet as acceptable. How can we possibly claim to be a top 6 level team if we can't convincingly win over teams like this. #needagoodshake

Motherwell got the better of Clyde in the Scottish League Cup, with Lennon Miller among the scorers. Moses Ebiye struck to give the visitors a 12th-minute lead only for Lee Hamilton to get Clyde back on terms just after the hour. Brian Kinnear fouled Miller, who netted the resulting penalty himself.And Filip Stuparevic netted his first Motherwell goal in added time. Stuart Kettlewell's side have eight points after three games, two more than second-placed Partick Thistle, who have played twice.

Horrendous display for a team of full-time professional players against part-time plumbers and sparkies. To go through on penalties is embarrassing frankly. Motherwell were denied a late Scottish League Cup group win away to Montrose but claimed a penalty shoot-out bonus point. Stuart Kettlewell's side looked set to make it two victories from two when defender Shane Blaney's first-half header went unanswered until late on. But midfielder Ali Shrive's finish on the spin meant the third-tier side would gain at least a draw while denying their top-flight visitors three points. However, Kettlewell's men ensured it was just one point they dropped, winning 5-4 on spot kicks after the full-time whistle. Edinburgh City and Clyde play the group's other midweek game on Wednesday.

A clean sheet at last but not as convincing a win as perhaps should have been. Motherwell got off to a strong start in their Scottish League Cup Group G campaign with a three-goal win over fourth-tier side Edinburgh City. Debutant Kofi Balmer, who left Crystal Palace this summer, got the visitors off the mark as he headed in from veteran Andy Halliday’s corner in the opening half. Fellow defender Dan Casey grabbed the second shortly after the break, once again finishing from a corner. Right-back Stephen O’Donnell delivered the third to secure the victory for Stuart Kettlewell's Premiership hosts.
Again, hardly easy and worryingly not a clean sheet. But a good session in places and some nice interplay between some of the squad.
Not a convincing win by any means, but a good try-out for some of the players.
A merky night in Easter Rd with an equally poor performance. One to forget.

A polished vicotry with some tasty play from the Steelmen.  A rare Paul McGinn goal, but the least he deserves for a great seasons efforts. Soft goals from opposition keepers errors aside, Motherwell were worthy winners, scoring three in the last ten minutes.

An impressive score but dissappointing to not get the clean sheet. Commentators claiming some of the VAR decisions were poor for Livingston, which is unfortunate, but like all the other cliche's in football - they even themselves out in the end. Great goal from Nicholson by all account - look forward to seeing it on the highlights.

An unimpressive start to the post-split games, and a long journey home to lick our wounds. Commentary says referee was not great, but that's no excuse. No goals scored and a man down for the majority of the second half - however reckless or not - isn't the performance the manager or supporters are expecting.

A scrappy affair by the radio commentary, with a fair few bookings for the visitors. A much deserved equaliser from the 'Well in the last minute of the game. Both teams landing in the bottom six for the final games.
Game should never have been allowed.  Pitch is a joke and potentially dangerous to play on - that said we pulled a victory out of the jaws of embarrasment.

An historic victory for the Well against the Mighty Rangers. No surprises the home team gets a soft penalty. First win in the league for over 25 years apparently. Worth watching over and over again. Casey megged the goalie with a header from a beautiful cross... Kelly was heroic and McGinn saved the day with an off-the-line clearance. #coyw
A pitiful performance from the Well.  Too late to everything, keeper had a mare of an evening and supporters got nothing for their efforts to raise the teams spirit.
A brilliant performance from all in Claret and Amber tonight. Especially Blair Spittal.  Bossed the midfield, was at the heart of everything and scored two great goals, one a contender for GOTS.
A very bitty game, no real stand out performances. Dissappointed to see Motherwell 'fans' booing Kevin Van Veen.  Short memories for those bampots.
A pinball disaster to concede the first goal. But the better of the two teams and the majority of the chances.
Good goals from us and a slack piece of defending to allow theirs. Safely through to the next round.
A fair result for a dismal game.
Good performance. Solid three points.
A tough point in strange circumstances. One of the penalties given was questionable at best. Player of the Match for Liam Kelly.
Another poor performance. Good fight to get the draw, but should never have been in that position in the first place. VAR takes away early goal and heads go down.
A continued poor run of form. Something needs to be done to return to winning ways, just not sure what or who it is will deliver it.
Far too late to join in the game. Poor goals to concede and woeful defending. Lots to learn if we want to move back up the table.
Self inflicted pain and misery. But an incredible turn-around to get the goals needed to salvage a point.

Motherwell were strong and deserved more out of this than they sadly got.  Refereeing decisions did not go there way, with Willy Collum doing some Fergie time, in order to let his favoured team Celtic get their winner.  Soft yellow card for Slattery and no yellow cards for any of the fouls that Motherwell had against them.

Motherwell started very brightly with Sam Lammers close to gifting a glaring chance before Callum Slattery found space and tried to bend one to the far corner. It was off target with Jack Butland exposed.

Motherwell peppered the St Mirren goal, hitting the bar late on with Georgie Gent's effort, but they couldn't find a way past Zach Hemming.  The St Mirren goal was against the run of play as Motherwell had started the second half stronger.
Again a poor first half from 'Well. Sublime pass from Blair Spittal to get the goal and some questionable refereeing with a soft first yellow and 50:50 second yellow for Paul McGinn.

Very poor first half from 'Well, stood off far too much and didn't really get into any kind of rhythm.  But we came out much improved and together in the second half. Some great play, a penalty we could have done better on and an impressive finish from two non-strikers.  Great team spirit and an important 3 points at the start of the season.

Painful defeat, not just in the sense of the match performance, but the injuries sustained too.  Some sore bodies coming off the pitch.  We'll dust ourselves down, look over the footage and try to grow, but that is the end of our cup run this season sadly.
Not much between the sides in the first half. Great substitution lifted our side and gave us the edge.
Good first half, but let the win slip away.
Another great result - good goals, team effort and clean sheet.  All is 'Well!!
Scrappy first 20 mins, but settled down after goal. referee gave us nothing at all - shocker!
Win 5/4 on penalties - some hairy tackles flying in. Good penalty save for win.
Great performance.
KVV 11th game in a row on the score sheet. Good final match of the season, despite losing the way after the first goal and equaliser.
Crazy goalkeeping from Livingston - bordering on assault. KVV 10th game in a row on the score sheet.
Great penalty from KVV - but refereeing nearly ruined a scrappy game.
Poor first half but ramped it up in the second. Great second attempt at the penalty from KVV and fantastic to see MM get his first premiership goal.
Great start with an early goal, but not an easy game by any means.  Solid defence and sublime touch from KVV to get his goal, could have been many more for him. McGinn was robbed by the post too.
Only team to take points off Celtic at Parkhead this season.  Would never have seen that coming earlier on this year. Incredible team effort!
Not a great result, but not the end of the world either. Calm heads and regroup for remainder of the campaign.
Fantastic game for the Steelmen!! Gutted KVV had his hat-trick denied.
Great result for performance. David Marshall lucky to still be on the pitch.
Great effort in a tough game, soft red card for Staggies.
Hard fought game, stunning equaliser from Slattery.
Another good result - Alan Burrows last game at the club.
Good result - but more consistancy needed.
Steven Hammell sacked after the game.
